parent_learning_goal: Strengthen the child’s ability to speak clearly in complete sentences.
why_it_matters: Full sentences improve clarity, confidence, and school readiness.
how_to_teach: Model complete sentences and gently prompt the child to expand short answers.
parent_tip: Expand their words instead of correcting harshly.

why_it_matters: Storytelling builds memory, sequencing, and expressive language.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to narrate daily events in their own words.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child answer questions using reasoning.
why_it_matters: Reasoning supports logical thinking and comprehension.
how_to_teach: Ask “why” and “how” questions during conversations.

parent_learning_goal: Improve the child’s ability to describe emotions verbally.
why_it_matters: Naming emotions helps self-regulation and empathy.
how_to_teach: Discuss feelings during stories, play, or daily events.

why_it_matters: Sequencing supports comprehension and academic narration.
how_to_teach: Use prompts like first, next, then, and last in daily talk.
parent_tip: Daily routines are natural sequencing lessons.

parent_learning_goal: Support clearer pronunciation and speech confidence.
why_it_matters: Clear speech improves understanding and confidence.
how_to_teach: Repeat mispronounced words correctly without direct criticism.
Role-play asking questions using polite phrases.
parent_tip: Children copy what they hear most.

why_it_matters: A rich vocabulary supports reading and expression.
how_to_teach: Introduce new words during play, reading, and outings.

why_it_matters: Interactive reading improves comprehension and interest.
how_to_teach: Pause during reading to ask predictions and opinions.
parent_tip: Reading together matters more than reading fast.

why_it_matters: Confidence in speech supports classroom participation.
how_to_teach: Give the child space to express opinions without interruption.
parent_tip: Confidence grows when children feel heard.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child explain ideas clearly to others.
why_it_matters: Explaining ideas strengthens clarity and structured thinking.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to explain how something works or why they chose it.
parent_tip: Clarity improves when children explain aloud.

why_it_matters: Turn-taking supports respectful communication and listening skills.
how_to_teach: Model waiting, listening, and responding during conversations.

why_it_matters: Descriptive language improves expression and comprehension.
how_to_teach: Encourage describing objects using size, color, texture, and function.

why_it_matters: Listening comprehension is essential for classroom learning.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to repeat or summarize what they heard.

why_it_matters: Asking questions strengthens curiosity and thinking.
how_to_teach: Respond positively when the child asks questions and invite more.
parent_tip: Curiosity is the start of learning.

how_to_teach: Guide the child to speak in order using simple structure prompts.
parent_tip: Structure makes speech easier to follow.

parent_learning_goal: Build confidence in speaking with adults.
why_it_matters: Confidence with adults supports school and social interactions.
how_to_teach: Encourage greeting, answering, and asking simple questions politely.

parent_learning_goal: Support understanding of new words from context.
how_to_teach: Explain new words using situations instead of definitions only.

why_it_matters: Sharing opinions builds confidence and reasoning.
how_to_teach: Ask what the child likes or prefers and why.

why_it_matters: Verbal memory supports learning and instructions.

parent_learning_goal: Support recognition of alphabet letters confidently.
why_it_matters: Letter recognition is the foundation for reading readiness.
how_to_teach: Use everyday objects, books, and signs to point out letters casually.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child understand letter sounds.
why_it_matters: Phonics links letters to reading and spelling.

why_it_matters: Proper grip reduces fatigue and supports writing control.

why_it_matters: Number recognition supports counting and math understanding.

why_it_matters: Object-based counting builds true number understanding.
how_to_teach: Count toys, snacks, or steps together aloud.

why_it_matters: Concrete addition builds early math confidence.
how_to_teach: Combine small groups of objects and count the total together.
Remove items from a group and count what remains.
parent_tip: Taking away is easier when seen.

parent_learning_goal: Improve awareness of size and comparison.
why_it_matters: Comparison supports math and reasoning skills.
how_to_teach: Compare objects using words like bigger, smaller, more, less.

why_it_matters: Time awareness supports routine and planning.

why_it_matters: Positive learning experiences build long-term motivation.

why_it_matters: Rhyming builds phonemic awareness needed for reading.

why_it_matters: Proper letter formation supports writing fluency.

why_it_matters: Skip counting supports number patterns and early multiplication.

why_it_matters: Number order helps with counting and math operations.

why_it_matters: Measurement skills support problem-solving and logic.

why_it_matters: Shape recognition supports geometry and visual skills.

why_it_matters: Sound-letter matching is essential for early reading.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage awareness of basic time measurement.

parent_learning_goal: Build confidence in early math problem-solving.

how_to_teach: Use everyday situations to ask simple math questions.
Praise effort and strategies rather than outcomes.

why_it_matters: Understanding quantity prevents rote counting without meaning.

Point out familiar words like the child’s name or common objects.

why_it_matters: Pattern recognition supports logic and math thinking.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage confidence in attempting new learning tasks.

parent_learning_goal: Improve understanding of comparison symbols conceptually.

parent_learning_goal: Support reading readiness through routine exposure.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child recognize and name basic emotions.

parent_learning_goal: Support expression of emotions using words.

parent_learning_goal: Teach calming strategies for strong emotions.

how_to_teach: Teach deep breathing or quiet time during calm moments.

why_it_matters: Waiting supports impulse control and classroom behavior.

Encourage breaks and verbalizing feelings during difficult tasks.

why_it_matters: Confidence helps children handle social and academic stress.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child recover from emotional setbacks.

why_it_matters: Trigger awareness helps prevent emotional overload.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage reflection on emotions after events.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child understand mixed emotions.

parent_learning_goal: Support emotion control during peer conflict.

Teach quiet activities like hugging a pillow or drawing.
Talk about different reactions and which fit the situation.

parent_learning_goal: Support emotional control in public settings.

Ask how another person might feel in situations.

why_it_matters: Boredom tolerance supports creativity and patience.

why_it_matters: Honesty builds trust and emotional health.
how_to_teach: Create a safe space for sharing feelings without judgment.
Discuss how actions affect others after emotional events.

why_it_matters: Listening skills support learning and relationships.

Make cleanup part of the activity routine.

parent_learning_goal: Support rule understanding at home and school.

Use visual or verbal reminders to guide routine completion.
Model respectful language and tone in daily interactions.

Discuss and practice indoor and outdoor voice levels.

how_to_teach: Give gentle, effort-focused feedback.

skill_name: Changing story endings or scenarios creatively
how_to_teach: Ask how the story could end differently.

why_it_matters: Initiation shows growing autonomy and confidence.
how_to_teach: Keep materials accessible and inviting.

skill_name: Talking about challenges faced during creation
how_to_teach: Ask what was hard and how they solved it.
parent_tip: Process matters as much as product.

parent_learning_goal: Build consistency in daily study routines.
why_it_matters: Consistency builds discipline and reduces stress.
how_to_teach: Set a fixed homework time each day.
Use short study blocks with clear goals.

skill_name: Preparing school bag the night before
how_to_teach: Use a checklist reviewed each evening.
Assign fixed places for school materials.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage asking questions in learning settings.
how_to_teach: Praise questions and model curiosity.
Stay nearby but avoid doing the work.
Use timers to show start and end times.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage calm responses to academic challenges.
skill_name: Staying calm when work feels difficult
how_to_teach: Pause, breathe, and break tasks into steps.

skill_name: Talking about what was learned in school
how_to_teach: Ask open-ended questions about the day.

skill_name: Taking care of books and supplies
how_to_teach: Teach gentle handling and storage routines.
Link homework start to a consistent daily cue.

skill_name: Taking short breaks without losing focus
why_it_matters: Balanced breaks prevent fatigue and distraction.
how_to_teach: Use timed breaks followed by clear restart cues.

skill_name: Raising hand to speak in class
why_it_matters: Orderly participation supports learning for all.
how_to_teach: Practice hand-raising during family discussions.

skill_name: Trying again after making academic mistakes
how_to_teach: Normalize mistakes and encourage retries.
Teach a simple check-before-submit routine.

skill_name: Preparing calmly for small tests or quizzes
how_to_teach: Use brief review sessions instead of cramming.

skill_name: Speaking politely to teachers and school staff
how_to_teach: Model polite greetings and responses.

skill_name: Adjusting to timetable or classroom changes
how_to_teach: Discuss changes ahead of time when possible.
Follow the child’s interests with books or videos.

parent_learning_goal: Build independence in managing school days.
how_to_teach: Review the daily schedule together and step back gradually.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage orderly start to learning sessions.
skill_name: Setting up study space before starting work
why_it_matters: A prepared space improves focus and efficiency.
how_to_teach: Create a simple checklist for setting up the study area.
Help the child identify must-do tasks before others.
Schedule short, frequent practice sessions.
Use a simple checklist or planner.

parent_learning_goal: Support calm response to school feedback.
why_it_matters: Positive response to feedback supports growth mindset.
how_to_teach: Discuss feedback as guidance, not judgment.

skill_name: Listening carefully to instructions before starting work
how_to_teach: Ask the child to repeat instructions briefly.
Practice sharing opinions during family talks.
Preview next subject before switching.

skill_name: Cleaning up study materials after use
why_it_matters: Clean-up habits support organization and respect.
how_to_teach: Make clean-up part of the study routine.
Explain once, then step back.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen sustained reading attention for longer texts.
skill_name: Reading a chapter book for 15–20 minutes independently
why_it_matters: Sustained reading builds comprehension stamina needed for higher grades.
how_to_teach: Set a daily quiet reading window and let the child choose the book.

skill_name: Identifying beginning, middle, and ending of a story
why_it_matters: Story structure awareness improves comprehension and writing.
how_to_teach: After reading, ask the child to retell the story in three parts.

skill_name: Writing a short paragraph with a clear main idea
how_to_teach: Help the child say the idea aloud before writing it down.
parent_dos: ['Encourage planning before writing', 'Focus on ideas first']

skill_name: Using new words correctly in conversation
why_it_matters: Vocabulary growth supports reading and academic success.
how_to_teach: Introduce one new word daily and model its use in sentences.
parent_dos: ['Use words in context', 'Invite the child to try']
parent_tip: One word a day adds up fast.

why_it_matters: Reasoning prepares children for discussions and debates.
how_to_teach: Ask “What makes you think that?” during conversations.
parent_tip: Reasoning matters more than being right.

skill_name: Answering questions after listening to a passage
how_to_teach: Read a short passage aloud and ask two follow-up questions.

skill_name: Speaking clearly in front of familiar people
why_it_matters: Confidence in speaking supports participation at school.
how_to_teach: Invite the child to explain a topic to family members.

skill_name: Understanding simple idioms and figurative phrases
why_it_matters: Figurative language is common in books and conversations.
how_to_teach: Explain idioms using everyday examples and humor.

why_it_matters: Good questions show understanding and curiosity.
how_to_teach: Model follow-up questions during shared reading or talks.

skill_name: Waiting for their turn to speak in discussions
why_it_matters: Turn-taking supports social and classroom success.
how_to_teach: Practice family discussions with clear turn rules.
parent_tip: Respectful talk is learned at home.

skill_name: Ordering sentences logically to form a paragraph
why_it_matters: Logical sequencing supports clear written communication.
how_to_teach: Give mixed-up sentences and ask the child to arrange them.

parent_learning_goal: Build awareness of audience in communication.
skill_name: Adjusting explanation based on who is listening
how_to_teach: Ask the child to explain the same idea to a younger sibling and an adult.
Pause during reading and ask why characters acted a certain way.

skill_name: Adding details when telling an experience
how_to_teach: Prompt with questions like who, where, and how it felt.

skill_name: Checking own writing for simple errors
how_to_teach: Create a short checklist for capitals, spacing, and punctuation.
parent_tip: Checking is a habit, not a test.

skill_name: Using voice changes while reading dialogue
why_it_matters: Expressive reading improves fluency and comprehension.
how_to_teach: Read a dialogue together and model voice variation.

skill_name: Disagreeing using calm and polite language
how_to_teach: Model phrases like “I think differently because…”

skill_name: Summarizing a short text in one or two sentences
how_to_teach: Ask the child to say the most important part after reading.

skill_name: Linking new topics to prior knowledge
why_it_matters: Connections improve comprehension and learning retention.
how_to_teach: Ask what the topic reminds them of from past experiences.

skill_name: Explaining steps in the correct order
how_to_teach: Ask the child to explain how to do a familiar task step by step.

skill_name: Explaining why characters make certain choices
why_it_matters: Understanding motivation builds empathy and comprehension.
how_to_teach: Pause after key scenes and ask what the character wanted and why.

skill_name: Using different sentence starters in a paragraph
why_it_matters: Sentence variety improves readability and style.
how_to_teach: Highlight repeated starters and brainstorm alternatives together.

skill_name: Identifying main topic and key facts
why_it_matters: Informational reading is essential for academic learning.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to name the topic and three facts after reading.

parent_learning_goal: Build confidence in asking for clarification.
skill_name: Requesting explanation when something is unclear
why_it_matters: Asking for help prevents learning gaps.
how_to_teach: Model phrases like “Can you explain that again?”

skill_name: Replacing common words with more precise ones
why_it_matters: Precise words improve clarity and impact.
how_to_teach: Together swap simple words with stronger alternatives.

skill_name: Summarizing a spoken story after listening
why_it_matters: Oral summaries support classroom listening tasks.
how_to_teach: Tell a short story and ask for a brief recap.

skill_name: Noticing how tone changes message meaning
how_to_teach: Say the same sentence in different tones and discuss meaning.

skill_name: Jotting key words while listening or reading
why_it_matters: Early note-taking supports future study habits.
how_to_teach: Show how to write single keywords instead of full sentences.
Gently remind the child of the topic when drifting.

skill_name: Sharing a short prepared talk with a clear ending
how_to_teach: Help plan a short talk with a clear start and finish.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen ability to infer meaning from context.
skill_name: Guessing word meaning using surrounding sentences
why_it_matters: Context clues reduce dependency on constant explanations.
how_to_teach: Pause at an unfamiliar word and ask what nearby sentences suggest.

parent_learning_goal: Improve logical flow in spoken stories.
skill_name: Telling events in correct chronological order
why_it_matters: Sequence clarity supports understanding by listeners.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to recount an event from start to finish.

skill_name: Explaining what message the author wants to share
how_to_teach: Ask what the author might want readers to learn or feel.

skill_name: Attempting spelling before asking for help
why_it_matters: Independent attempts build confidence and learning.
how_to_teach: Encourage sounding out words first, then checking.

skill_name: Using linking words to connect ideas
why_it_matters: Linking words improve coherence in writing.
how_to_teach: Introduce words like because, so, and but through examples.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen ability to follow verbal instructions.
skill_name: Completing a task after listening to multi-step directions
why_it_matters: Multi-step listening is vital for classroom tasks.
how_to_teach: Give two to three steps verbally and observe completion.

skill_name: Changing reading pace based on punctuation
how_to_teach: Model pausing at commas and stopping at periods.
Practice turn-taking during family discussions.

skill_name: Saying the same idea using different words
how_to_teach: Ask the child to explain an idea in a new way.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen confidence in basic multiplication concepts.
why_it_matters: Conceptual understanding prevents rote memorization errors later.
how_to_teach: Use groups of objects to show how repeated addition becomes multiplication.

parent_learning_goal: Improve accuracy in subtraction with borrowing.

why_it_matters: Place value understanding reduces calculation mistakes.
how_to_teach: Break numbers into tens and ones before subtracting.
parent_tip: Place value is the key to accuracy.

why_it_matters: Concrete division builds foundation for abstract math.
how_to_teach: Use snacks or toys to practice equal sharing.

skill_name: Solving word problems by identifying key information
why_it_matters: Word problems connect math to real-life situations.
how_to_teach: Highlight important numbers and words together.
parent_donts: ['Solve it for the child', 'Focus only on speed']
parent_tip: Understanding the question is half the solution.

skill_name: Recognizing halves and quarters in everyday items
why_it_matters: Early fraction sense supports later math learning.

skill_name: Reading time on an analog clock to the nearest 5 minutes
why_it_matters: Time awareness builds independence and routine management.

parent_donts: ['Rely only on digital clocks', 'Expect instant mastery']

skill_name: Identifying patterns in numbers and shapes

skill_name: Measuring length using centimeters and meters
why_it_matters: Measurement connects math to the physical world.

skill_name: Adding coins and notes to find total value
how_to_teach: Use pretend shopping with real or toy money.

why_it_matters: Puzzles develop patience and analytical thinking.
how_to_teach: Work through a puzzle together, discussing each step.

skill_name: Recalling basic multiplication facts for 2, 3, 5, and 10
why_it_matters: Fluency frees mental space for higher-level problem solving.

parent_tip: Short and regular beats long and tiring.

skill_name: Using terms like share, group, and equal correctly
why_it_matters: Correct language supports clear mathematical thinking.

parent_dos: ['Use math words aloud', 'Ask the child to explain']

parent_learning_goal: Improve accuracy in addition with regrouping.

why_it_matters: Regrouping is a foundation for advanced arithmetic.

skill_name: Estimating answers before solving math problems
why_it_matters: Estimation helps children check if answers make sense.

skill_name: Reading simple bar graphs and pictographs
why_it_matters: Data interpretation is used across school subjects.
how_to_teach: Create a simple chart from daily choices like favorite fruit.

skill_name: Estimating and measuring how long activities take
why_it_matters: Time awareness supports planning and independence.
how_to_teach: Time daily tasks and compare estimates with actual time.

skill_name: Solving simple calculations without writing them down
why_it_matters: Mental math improves flexibility and speed.
how_to_teach: Ask short mental math questions during daily routines.

skill_name: Comparing numbers using greater than and less than

Find shapes in the home and discuss sides and corners.
Ask what else could be tried instead of giving answers.

skill_name: Breaking numbers into tens and ones mentally
why_it_matters: Number decomposition supports mental math and estimation.
how_to_teach: Practice splitting numbers during everyday counting situations.
Use short daily practice with number cards or oral questions.

parent_learning_goal: Build understanding of fractions as parts of a whole.
skill_name: Explaining what a fraction represents using objects
why_it_matters: Conceptual fraction knowledge prevents confusion later.
how_to_teach: Use food or paper to show equal parts of a whole.

why_it_matters: Skip-counting supports multiplication and number sense.

Use tiles or paper squares to cover surfaces.
Create simple scenarios using everyday rules.

parent_learning_goal: Improve accuracy in reading word problems.

why_it_matters: Understanding the question prevents careless mistakes.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to restate the question in their own words.

why_it_matters: Spatial skills support geometry and problem solving.
how_to_teach: Use puzzles or blocks to rotate shapes physically.

skill_name: Calculating simple change after a purchase

how_to_teach: Role-play buying and selling with small amounts.
Ask whether the answer makes sense before finalizing.

skill_name: Placing numbers correctly on a number line
why_it_matters: Number lines build magnitude sense and ordering.
how_to_teach: Draw a number line and ask the child to place given numbers.

how_to_teach: Compare groups like two apples for every one orange.

skill_name: Rounding numbers to the nearest ten
how_to_teach: Use number lines to decide which ten is closer.

skill_name: Finding a fair share as an average
how_to_teach: Redistribute items to make piles equal.

skill_name: Sorting objects by more than one attribute

skill_name: Calculating how much time has passed between two events

skill_name: Solving problems that require more than one operation

skill_name: Learning from incorrect answers without frustration
how_to_teach: Review mistakes together and identify what changed.

parent_learning_goal: Help the child recognize complex emotions accurately.

why_it_matters: Naming emotions is the first step to managing them well.
how_to_teach: Discuss characters’ emotions in stories and relate them to real-life moments.

parent_learning_goal: Build healthy ways to express strong emotions.

how_to_teach: Prompt the child to describe what they feel before reacting.

skill_name: Using breathing to calm down when upset
how_to_teach: Practice slow breathing together during calm moments.

why_it_matters: Owning mistakes builds honesty and resilience.

why_it_matters: Internal confidence protects against peer pressure.
how_to_teach: Regularly highlight effort and personal growth.

why_it_matters: Resilience helps children bounce back from challenges.
how_to_teach: Talk through what went wrong and what can be tried next time.

skill_name: Managing nervousness before tests or presentations

why_it_matters: Pausing reduces impulsive words and actions.

skill_name: Recognizing how actions affect others emotionally

skill_name: Using coping strategies without adult prompting

skill_name: Recognizing more than one feeling at the same time
why_it_matters: Understanding mixed emotions supports emotional maturity.

parent_learning_goal: Build emotional awareness during daily routines.

skill_name: Continuing a task after initial difficulty
how_to_teach: Encourage one more try before taking a break.

skill_name: Replacing negative self-talk with neutral statements
how_to_teach: Model changing “I can’t” to “I’m learning.”
Explain what to change next time instead of focusing on blame.

why_it_matters: Comfort with uncertainty supports problem solving.
how_to_teach: Say “Let’s figure it out together” during unknowns.

skill_name: Calming down and reconnecting after an argument
how_to_teach: Guide a short cool-down followed by discussion.

skill_name: Managing feelings without immediate adult presence
how_to_teach: Role-play school situations and coping responses.
Teach “I feel” statements during conflicts.

skill_name: Using quiet activities to regain calm
how_to_teach: Create a list of calming activities the child enjoys.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen emotional awareness during success moments.
why_it_matters: Balanced pride supports confidence and humility.
how_to_teach: Discuss achievements and how effort led to success.

why_it_matters: Flexibility helps children move forward quickly.
how_to_teach: Guide the child to name the feeling and choose a next action.

skill_name: Identifying situations that cause strong reactions
how_to_teach: Reflect together after emotional moments.

skill_name: Responding to teasing without emotional escalation
how_to_teach: Role-play teasing scenarios and calm replies.

skill_name: Sharing difficult feelings with trusted adults
why_it_matters: Emotional honesty prevents internal stress buildup.
how_to_teach: Create predictable times for open conversation.

why_it_matters: Anticipation helps children prepare coping strategies.
how_to_teach: Discuss how certain events might feel beforehand.

why_it_matters: Patience supports self-control and social behavior.
how_to_teach: Use waiting moments to practice calming techniques.

skill_name: Trying again after an unsuccessful attempt
how_to_teach: Review what was learned before retrying.
Practice expressing feelings with respectful language.
Reflect on which strategy worked best after calming down.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen awareness of body signals linked to emotions.

why_it_matters: Body awareness helps children regulate emotions earlier.

parent_learning_goal: Improve recovery after making a mistake publicly.
how_to_teach: Share stories of small mistakes and how they were handled.

skill_name: Using similar coping strategies at home and school

skill_name: Waiting to enjoy rewards after completing tasks
how_to_teach: Set clear task–reward sequences and follow through.

parent_learning_goal: Support emotional balance during busy days.
skill_name: Recognizing emotional overload and requesting a break
how_to_teach: Teach the child to signal when they need a short break.

skill_name: Thinking about what helped emotions settle
how_to_teach: Briefly discuss what worked after calming down.

skill_name: Facing uncomfortable feelings instead of avoiding them
how_to_teach: Encourage small steps toward uncomfortable situations.

skill_name: Choosing actions that reduce emotional stress
how_to_teach: Ask what action might help feelings improve.

why_it_matters: Transitions are common emotional stress points.
how_to_teach: Give advance notice and name possible feelings.

skill_name: Recognizing personal improvement in emotional control
how_to_teach: Point out moments when the child handled emotions better.

parent_learning_goal: Build consistency in following daily routines independently.
skill_name: Completing morning routines without repeated reminders
why_it_matters: Routine independence reduces stress and builds responsibility.
how_to_teach: Create a simple visual routine chart and review it once daily.

skill_name: Submitting homework on time without chasing
why_it_matters: Timely submission builds trust and reliability.
how_to_teach: Set a fixed homework check time each evening.
parent_donts: ['Complete homework for the child', 'Scold late work']

skill_name: Following household rules even when unsupervised
why_it_matters: Internalized rules guide behavior beyond adult presence.

skill_name: Keeping school bag and supplies organized
why_it_matters: Organization supports learning efficiency and independence.
how_to_teach: Do a weekly bag-cleaning routine together at first.

skill_name: Accepting natural consequences of actions calmly

skill_name: Telling the truth even when mistakes occur
why_it_matters: Honesty builds trust and moral development.

why_it_matters: Respect for property supports social trust.
how_to_teach: Model asking permission before using items.

skill_name: Noticing when behavior breaks a rule

skill_name: Following the same rules at home and outside
how_to_teach: Discuss which rules apply everywhere and why.
Help the child list steps before starting a task.
parent_donts: ['Do the planning for them', 'Expect instant mastery']

skill_name: Fixing behavior after noticing a mistake
how_to_teach: Prompt reflection with “What could you do differently?”
Discuss how choices affect everyone involved.

skill_name: Changing behavior after being reminded once
how_to_teach: Use one clear reminder followed by space to act.

skill_name: Listening to teachers and adults without arguing
how_to_teach: Role-play listening and responding calmly.

skill_name: Estimating how long tasks will take
why_it_matters: Time estimation supports planning and punctuality.
how_to_teach: Time tasks together and compare estimates to reality.

skill_name: Asking about rules calmly instead of resisting
how_to_teach: Invite calm questions during non-conflict times.

skill_name: Cleaning up shared areas after use
how_to_teach: Set clear expectations for cleanup after activities.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen consistency in personal hygiene habits.
why_it_matters: Hygiene independence supports health and confidence.
how_to_teach: Use a simple checklist for hygiene steps.

why_it_matters: Ownership of choices builds maturity and accountability.
how_to_teach: Discuss choices made and what followed without blaming.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage consistency in rule-following during excitement.
skill_name: Following rules even during play or celebrations
why_it_matters: Self-control during excitement supports safety and fairness.
how_to_teach: Remind rules before high-energy activities begin.

skill_name: Starting assigned tasks without being prompted
how_to_teach: Set a regular time when tasks are expected to begin.
Teach acceptable ways to express frustration verbally.
Agree on consequences in advance and apply calmly.

parent_learning_goal: Promote respectful use of shared time.
skill_name: Ending activities when time is over
how_to_teach: Give time warnings before activities end.

parent_learning_goal: Build responsibility for personal safety rules.
how_to_teach: Explain safety rules and practice them regularly.
Teach a short pause routine before decisions.
Explain how each role helps the family function.

skill_name: Maintaining routines even when motivation is low
how_to_teach: Stick to routines gently even on low-energy days.

skill_name: Recovering responsibly after forgetting a task
why_it_matters: Learning recovery builds responsibility without fear.
how_to_teach: Guide the child to decide how to fix or complete the missed task.

parent_learning_goal: Build consistency in behavior during transitions.
skill_name: Following rules when moving between activities
why_it_matters: Transitions are common points of rule-breaking.
how_to_teach: State expectations clearly before transitions begin.

why_it_matters: Openness to feedback supports growth and learning.
how_to_teach: Model listening and responding calmly to feedback.

why_it_matters: Shared decision-making builds fairness and respect.
how_to_teach: Practice simple family votes with clear rules.

parent_learning_goal: Support consistency in behavior under peer influence.
skill_name: Following rules even when friends encourage breaking them
why_it_matters: Rule consistency protects safety and values.
how_to_teach: Role-play peer-pressure situations and responses.
Link privileges to responsible behavior clearly.
Review recurring situations calmly and identify patterns.

parent_learning_goal: Build responsibility for materials and resources.
skill_name: Taking care of school and activity materials
why_it_matters: Material care reflects responsibility and respect.
how_to_teach: Set routines for checking and storing materials.

skill_name: Returning to tasks calmly after being corrected

Gradually reduce reminders while observing behavior.

parent_learning_goal: Build independence in daily school preparation.
skill_name: Packing the school bag without reminders
why_it_matters: Independent preparation builds responsibility and confidence.
how_to_teach: Create a simple checklist and let the child follow it alone.
parent_tip: Preparation is a daily life skill.

how_to_teach: Encourage the child to note homework in a planner.

skill_name: Selecting appropriate clothes for the day
how_to_teach: Discuss weather and activities before choosing clothes.

skill_name: Completing showering and brushing routines independently
why_it_matters: Hygiene independence supports health and self-care.
how_to_teach: Use a simple hygiene routine chart in the bathroom.

parent_learning_goal: Build confidence in simple food preparation.
how_to_teach: Demonstrate once, then supervise from a distance.

skill_name: Keeping track of personal items outside the home
how_to_teach: Assign a consistent place for items when returning home.

why_it_matters: Time structure supports balance and independence.
how_to_teach: Create a visual schedule with study, play, and rest.

skill_name: Making simple choices without adult approval
how_to_teach: Allow safe choices and discuss outcomes afterward.

parent_learning_goal: Build persistence in completing self-care tasks.
skill_name: Finishing tasks even when they feel boring
how_to_teach: Break tasks into short segments with clear endings.

skill_name: Checking supplies needed for the next school day

parent_learning_goal: Support confidence in presenting creative work.
skill_name: Showing creative projects to others confidently
why_it_matters: Presentation builds pride and communication skills.
how_to_teach: Invite the child to explain their project to family members.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage curiosity about change and improvement.
skill_name: Wondering how things could be made better
how_to_teach: Ask what could be changed or improved in everyday items.

skill_name: Seeing oneself as a creative thinker
how_to_teach: Use language that recognizes creativity as a strength.
parent_tip: Creativity is part of who they are.

parent_learning_goal: Build a consistent daily study routine.
skill_name: Starting homework at a planned time each day
why_it_matters: Consistency reduces resistance and improves focus.
how_to_teach: Set a fixed homework time and follow it on school days.
Use a visible timer and short breaks after completion.

why_it_matters: Organization reduces stress and lost time.
how_to_teach: Assign a fixed place for each school item.

parent_learning_goal: Build confidence in asking questions at school.
skill_name: Asking teachers for clarification when confused
how_to_teach: Practice asking clear questions through role-play.
parent_donts: ['Label questions as silly', 'Speak for the child']

skill_name: Attempting homework before asking for help
why_it_matters: Independent effort builds confidence and problem-solving.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to try one question first before helping.

skill_name: Packing the school bag the night before
how_to_teach: Create a simple checklist for nightly packing.
Ask about one good thing learned each day.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen communication between home and school.
skill_name: Sharing school updates accurately with parents
why_it_matters: Clear communication helps parents support learning.
how_to_teach: Use daily check-in questions about school.

why_it_matters: Calm review improves recall and confidence.
how_to_teach: Break revision into small sessions over days.

skill_name: Reflecting on what went well and what needs improvement
how_to_teach: Discuss one strength and one improvement after tasks.

skill_name: Estimating how long homework will take
why_it_matters: Time awareness helps planning and reduces procrastination.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to guess time needed, then compare after completion.

skill_name: Setting up the study space independently
how_to_teach: Teach a simple setup routine for the desk.

skill_name: Staying engaged when tasks feel difficult
how_to_teach: Encourage trying one more step before stopping.
Practice giving two- or three-step instructions at home.
Teach a simple review checklist after tasks.
Practice answering aloud at home without judgment.

why_it_matters: Calm responses support learning from errors.
how_to_teach: Model calm reactions to mistakes and discuss learning points.
Help divide homework into clear steps initially.
Schedule short breaks after focused work blocks.
Use a simple calendar to track due dates.

parent_learning_goal: Build ownership of daily learning tasks.
skill_name: Remembering and starting homework without reminders
why_it_matters: Ownership reduces dependence and builds responsibility.
how_to_teach: Use a visible routine chart and slowly fade reminders.

skill_name: Explaining what was read in own words
how_to_teach: Ask the child to summarize the main idea after reading.

skill_name: Practicing reading or math daily without resistance
how_to_teach: Schedule short, predictable daily practice slots.

skill_name: Using teacher comments to improve work
how_to_teach: Review one comment and apply it to the next task.

skill_name: Shifting from playtime to study without conflict
how_to_teach: Give a five-minute warning before study time.
Praise strategies and effort, not intelligence.
Discuss class rules and why they matter.

skill_name: Speaking clearly during oral answers or presentations
why_it_matters: Clear speech supports confidence and understanding.
how_to_teach: Practice answering questions aloud at home.

skill_name: Using simple notes or drawings to remember information
how_to_teach: Encourage quick sketches or keywords after learning.
Invite the child to explain what they did well.
parent_donts: ['Focus only on errors', 'Rush to next task']

parent_learning_goal: Build consistency in morning school routines.
skill_name: Getting ready for school on time independently
why_it_matters: Smooth mornings set a positive tone for learning.
how_to_teach: Create a simple morning checklist and practice it daily.
parent_donts: ['Rush last minute', 'Do tasks for the child']

skill_name: Listening carefully during lessons without distractions
why_it_matters: Active listening improves understanding and retention.
how_to_teach: Practice listening games that require recalling instructions.
parent_tip: Listening is the first step to learning.

why_it_matters: Tracking prevents missed or forgotten work.
how_to_teach: Teach using a simple notebook or planner daily.

skill_name: Arriving prepared and calm for tests
how_to_teach: Prepare materials the night before and practice relaxation.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage balance between school and play.
skill_name: Switching from study time to play responsibly
why_it_matters: Balance prevents burnout and improves motivation.
how_to_teach: Set clear end times for study before free play.

skill_name: Noticing when focus is slipping and resetting attention
how_to_teach: Teach short pause-and-reset strategies during study.

skill_name: Waiting for turn before speaking in class
how_to_teach: Practice turn-taking during family discussions.
Discuss what can be tried differently next time.
Connect school skills to real-life applications.

skill_name: Seeing oneself as a capable learner
why_it_matters: Positive identity supports persistence and success.
how_to_teach: Use language that highlights growth and effort.

parent_learning_goal: Support deep understanding of chapter books.
skill_name: Guiding children to summarize chapters in their own words
why_it_matters: Summarization shows true comprehension beyond surface reading.
how_to_teach: After reading, ask the child to explain what happened without looking at the book.
parent_tip: Understanding is clearer when children explain ideas themselves.

parent_learning_goal: Build analytical thinking while reading stories.
why_it_matters: Analyzing motives strengthens reasoning and empathy.
how_to_teach: Ask why a character acted a certain way and what alternatives they had.
parent_donts: ['Force a single answer', 'Turn it into a lecture']
parent_tip: Good questions matter more than perfect answers.

skill_name: Organizing spoken ideas in logical order
why_it_matters: Clear structure helps children express thoughts confidently.
how_to_teach: Teach them to speak using beginning–middle–end format.
parent_tip: Structure turns ideas into confident communication.

skill_name: Writing short paragraphs with a clear main idea
why_it_matters: Paragraph structure is foundational for academic writing.
how_to_teach: Help the child write one main idea sentence followed by details.
parent_tip: Strong writing starts with clear thinking.

skill_name: Introducing new words in natural contexts
how_to_teach: Use new words during regular conversations and explain meaning briefly.
parent_tip: Words stick better when used in real life.

why_it_matters: Listening is essential for learning and respectful communication.
how_to_teach: Practice turn-taking during family discussions.
parent_tip: Good communicators are first good listeners.

parent_learning_goal: Build confidence in public speaking situations.
skill_name: Practicing short oral presentations at home
why_it_matters: Early practice reduces fear of speaking in groups.
how_to_teach: Let the child present a topic to family members weekly.

skill_name: Explaining idioms and metaphors in daily use
why_it_matters: Figurative language improves comprehension of complex texts.
how_to_teach: Explain common idioms when they appear in books or speech.
parent_tip: Abstract language becomes clear through examples.

skill_name: Teaching children to ask meaningful follow-up questions
how_to_teach: Model asking “why” and “how” questions during discussions.

skill_name: Retelling events with clear sequence and detail
why_it_matters: Sequencing supports both speaking and writing development.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to narrate daily events in order.

skill_name: Identifying the main theme of a story
how_to_teach: After finishing a story, ask what message the author wanted to share.
parent_tip: Themes help children connect stories to real life.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen grammar usage in daily communication.
skill_name: Using correct tense while speaking and writing
why_it_matters: Proper tense use improves clarity and academic accuracy.
how_to_teach: Gently restate sentences using correct tense during conversation.
parent_tip: Children learn grammar best by hearing it used correctly.

how_to_teach: Ask the child what they think and why during discussions.
parent_tip: Reasoned opinions matter more than being right.

skill_name: Recognizing common spelling rules and word families
how_to_teach: Group similar words together and discuss patterns.

skill_name: Extracting key facts from non-fiction reading
how_to_teach: Ask the child to list three important facts after reading.
parent_tip: Facts are easier to remember when discussed.

why_it_matters: Staying on topic improves clarity and social communication.
how_to_teach: Gently remind the child of the topic if they drift away.

skill_name: Explaining why events happen in stories
how_to_teach: Ask what caused an event and what happened because of it.
parent_tip: Understanding causes leads to deeper understanding.

skill_name: Reviewing written work for clarity and completeness
why_it_matters: Self-review improves writing quality and independence.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to reread their writing and check if it makes sense.
Role-play disagreements using calm and polite words.

skill_name: Adding descriptive details to spoken stories
why_it_matters: Descriptions make communication engaging and vivid.
how_to_teach: Encourage adding details about place, feelings, and actions.

parent_learning_goal: Build reading stamina for longer texts.
skill_name: Sustaining attention while reading chapter books
why_it_matters: Reading stamina supports academic success across subjects.
how_to_teach: Gradually increase reading time and discuss progress.
parent_tip: Stamina grows with consistency, not pressure.

skill_name: Identifying beginning, conflict, and resolution in stories
why_it_matters: Story structure improves comprehension and writing skills.
how_to_teach: Ask the child to map story parts after reading.
parent_tip: Knowing structure makes stories easier to understand.

skill_name: Exploring how different characters see the same situation
why_it_matters: Perspective-taking builds empathy and critical thinking.
how_to_teach: Discuss how events might feel to different characters.
Model correct sentences during everyday conversations.

skill_name: Using context clues to understand unfamiliar words
how_to_teach: Ask the child to guess meanings using surrounding sentences.

skill_name: Explaining ideas in writing with examples
how_to_teach: Ask the child to add one example to explain an idea.

skill_name: Adjusting language based on the listener
how_to_teach: Discuss how to explain ideas differently to adults and peers.

skill_name: Noticing when something read does not make sense
how_to_teach: Encourage stopping and rereading confusing sections.

why_it_matters: Variety improves writing quality and interest.
how_to_teach: Show examples of sentences starting in different ways.
Model taking a short pause before answering questions.
parent_tip: Thinking first leads to better answers.

why_it_matters: Conceptual understanding prevents rote memorization errors.
how_to_teach: Use real objects to show groups being added together.
Divide snacks or objects equally among people.

skill_name: Recognizing common fractions in daily life
why_it_matters: Fractions are easier when connected to real objects.
how_to_teach: Use food portions to show halves and quarters.

skill_name: Breaking word problems into smaller steps
how_to_teach: Teach the child to underline key information and plan steps.
parent_donts: ['Solve it for them', 'Focus only on answers']

why_it_matters: Estimation builds reasoning and error checking.
how_to_teach: Ask for a rough guess before solving exactly.

why_it_matters: Time management depends on clock reading.
how_to_teach: Practice reading both analog and digital clocks daily.
parent_tip: Time awareness grows with daily use.

why_it_matters: Patterns are foundational to algebraic thinking.
how_to_teach: Use number and shape patterns for practice.

skill_name: Using standard units for length and weight
why_it_matters: Measurement connects math to real-world tasks.
how_to_teach: Measure household objects using rulers and scales.

skill_name: Checking work for simple calculation errors
how_to_teach: Teach children to recheck answers using a different method.
parent_tip: Checking work is a smart habit.

skill_name: Solving the same problem using different methods
how_to_teach: Ask if there is another way to solve a problem.
parent_tip: There is often more than one right path.

how_to_teach: Highlight patterns like even/odd or multiples of 5 and 10.

skill_name: Connecting division facts to known multiplication facts
why_it_matters: Linking operations improves recall and understanding.
how_to_teach: Show how each division fact relates to a multiplication fact.

skill_name: Comparing fractions with the same denominator
why_it_matters: Comparison builds number sense with fractions.
how_to_teach: Use visual models to compare fraction sizes.

skill_name: Deciding which operation to use in word problems
why_it_matters: Choosing the right operation prevents common mistakes.
how_to_teach: Teach keywords and context clues in word problems.
Practice buying and selling scenarios at home.

skill_name: Choosing appropriate units for different measurements
how_to_teach: Discuss why some objects are measured in meters, grams, or liters.
parent_tip: Units matter as much as numbers.

skill_name: Calculating elapsed time for daily activities
why_it_matters: Elapsed time supports planning and punctuality.
how_to_teach: Ask how long activities take using start and end times.

skill_name: Comparing quantities using greater than and less than
how_to_teach: Use real objects to compare quantities.

parent_learning_goal: Develop accuracy with written math work.
skill_name: Aligning numbers correctly in multi-digit calculations
how_to_teach: Teach lining up place values when writing problems.

skill_name: Explaining how an answer was found
how_to_teach: Ask the child to describe each step used to solve a problem.

parent_learning_goal: Develop understanding of fractions on a number line.
skill_name: Placing fractions correctly on a number line
why_it_matters: Number lines help visualize fraction size and order.
how_to_teach: Draw a number line and mark common fractions between whole numbers.

skill_name: Solving word problems that require two or more operations
why_it_matters: Multi-step problems build planning and persistence.
how_to_teach: Teach the child to write steps before calculating.

skill_name: Reading and interpreting simple graphs and charts
why_it_matters: Graph reading supports math and science learning.
how_to_teach: Use bar graphs or pictographs and ask interpretation questions.
parent_dos: ['Ask what the data shows', 'Relate to real examples']

skill_name: Breaking numbers into thousands, hundreds, tens, and ones
why_it_matters: Place value underpins all multi-digit operations.
how_to_teach: Use expanded form to show number breakdowns.
parent_tip: Place value is the backbone of math.

skill_name: Rounding numbers to estimate sums and differences
why_it_matters: Rounding helps check if answers are reasonable.
how_to_teach: Teach rounding rules and apply them before exact calculation.

skill_name: Identifying types of angles in shapes
why_it_matters: Angle knowledge supports later geometry learning.
how_to_teach: Find right, acute, and obtuse angles in household objects.

skill_name: Converting between common units within the same system
how_to_teach: Practice converting meters to centimeters or hours to minutes.

skill_name: Sorting objects or numbers based on multiple properties
how_to_teach: Sort items by size, shape, or number characteristics.

skill_name: Writing clear and complete math solutions
why_it_matters: Clear presentation supports understanding and grading.
how_to_teach: Encourage writing numbers, steps, and units neatly.

skill_name: Staying engaged when math problems feel difficult
why_it_matters: Persistence leads to long-term academic success.
how_to_teach: Teach short breaks and positive self-talk during challenges.

skill_name: Recognizing different fractions that represent the same value
why_it_matters: Equivalence is essential for fraction operations later.
how_to_teach: Use fraction strips or drawings to show equal parts.

why_it_matters: Regrouping is foundational for accurate calculations.
how_to_teach: Use place value blocks to demonstrate borrowing.

skill_name: Using mental math strategies for addition
why_it_matters: Mental strategies improve speed and confidence.
how_to_teach: Teach breaking numbers into friendly tens.

skill_name: Finding simple averages using real-life data
how_to_teach: Calculate average scores or daily steps together.

skill_name: Identifying symmetry in shapes and objects
how_to_teach: Fold paper shapes to show lines of symmetry.
parent_tip: Symmetry is easiest to see, not memorize.

why_it_matters: Decimals prepare children for advanced math.
how_to_teach: Use coins and prices to show tenths.

skill_name: Creating simple tables to organize data
why_it_matters: Data organization supports clarity and analysis.
how_to_teach: Collect data and record it in rows and columns.
parent_tip: Organized data is easier to understand.

skill_name: Using area models to represent multiplication
why_it_matters: Area models show why multiplication works.
how_to_teach: Draw grids to represent multiplication problems.
Ask what they think will happen before solving.

skill_name: Identifying and fixing mistakes without immediate help
how_to_teach: Ask guiding questions instead of giving answers.
parent_tip: Finding mistakes is part of learning.

skill_name: Identifying mixed emotions in daily situations
why_it_matters: Understanding mixed emotions supports emotional awareness and regulation.
how_to_teach: Discuss situations where a child might feel two emotions at once.
parent_tip: It’s okay to feel more than one thing at a time.

skill_name: Using calm breathing to manage strong emotions
how_to_teach: Practice slow breathing together during calm moments.
parent_tip: Calm skills work best when practiced early.

skill_name: Talking about mistakes as learning opportunities
why_it_matters: Reframing mistakes reduces fear of failure.
how_to_teach: Share examples of mistakes and what was learned.
Introduce emotion words beyond happy or sad.
Talk about body and behavior signals of stress.
parent_tip: Stress is easier to manage when noticed early.

skill_name: Talking about feelings at the end of the day
how_to_teach: Ask what felt good and what felt hard today.

skill_name: Using positive self-talk during difficult tasks
how_to_teach: Model phrases like ‘I can try again.’
parent_tip: What children say to themselves matters.

how_to_teach: Practice saying no politely in role-play scenarios.

skill_name: Considering how others might feel in situations
why_it_matters: Empathy strengthens friendships and social understanding.
how_to_teach: Discuss how actions affect others’ feelings.
Discuss what helps calm down after strong emotions.

skill_name: Recognizing situations that trigger strong emotions
why_it_matters: Awareness of triggers supports better self-control.
how_to_teach: Talk about what situations tend to cause big reactions.

skill_name: Shifting from negative emotions to neutral states
how_to_teach: Teach short reset activities like stretching or walking.

skill_name: Handling unmet expectations without emotional shutdown
how_to_teach: Acknowledge feelings and discuss alternative plans.
parent_tip: Disappointment can be managed, not avoided.

how_to_teach: Teach ‘I feel’ statements during discussions.

skill_name: Using journaling or drawing to express feelings
why_it_matters: Creative outlets help process emotions safely.
how_to_teach: Offer a notebook or drawing time after emotional moments.

skill_name: Speaking up about feelings in group settings
why_it_matters: Confidence in expression supports social well-being.
how_to_teach: Practice sharing feelings in small family groups.

skill_name: Waiting calmly when outcomes are uncertain
how_to_teach: Discuss strategies for managing waiting periods.

skill_name: Responding calmly instead of reacting impulsively
how_to_teach: Teach pause-and-think strategies before reacting.

skill_name: Apologizing sincerely and rebuilding emotional trust
how_to_teach: Guide children to acknowledge hurt and express regret.

skill_name: Remembering past challenges that were successfully handled
why_it_matters: Reflecting on success builds confidence for future challenges.
how_to_teach: Remind children of past difficulties they overcame.

parent_learning_goal: Help children cope with peer comparison.
skill_name: Managing feelings that arise from comparing with others
why_it_matters: Comparison can affect self-esteem and motivation.
how_to_teach: Discuss personal strengths instead of comparing achievements.
parent_tip: Confidence grows when focus stays on self-growth.

skill_name: Admitting feelings instead of hiding them
why_it_matters: Emotional honesty builds trust and self-acceptance.
how_to_teach: Model sharing feelings openly in age-appropriate ways.

skill_name: Managing overly excited emotions without losing control
why_it_matters: Strong positive emotions also need regulation.
how_to_teach: Practice calming techniques even during happy excitement.

parent_learning_goal: Build courage in emotionally difficult moments.
skill_name: Facing fears by taking small emotional steps
how_to_teach: Break fears into small, manageable challenges.

skill_name: Staying emotionally engaged during long or tiring tasks
why_it_matters: Emotional stamina supports academic and personal success.
how_to_teach: Teach short breaks and encouragement during long tasks.

skill_name: Managing emotions without immediate adult intervention
how_to_teach: Pause before stepping in and let the child try coping.
parent_tip: Support doesn’t always mean stepping in.

how_to_teach: Teach noticing mistakes without negative labels.

parent_learning_goal: Strengthen emotional awareness in social settings.
why_it_matters: Social awareness supports empathy and friendships.
how_to_teach: Discuss facial expressions and tone in social situations.

why_it_matters: Holding onto small issues increases stress.
how_to_teach: Discuss which problems are worth carrying forward.
parent_tip: Not everything needs to be carried.

skill_name: Managing emotions before tests or performances
how_to_teach: Practice calming routines before evaluations.

parent_learning_goal: Help children cope with unexpected changes.
skill_name: Adapting emotionally when plans change suddenly
how_to_teach: Talk through what changed and identify what remains the same.

skill_name: Separating facts from feelings during disagreements
how_to_teach: Help the child state what happened and how it felt as two parts.

skill_name: Continuing effort even when praise is not immediate
how_to_teach: Highlight effort and progress rather than constant rewards.
parent_tip: Motivation lasts when it comes from within.

skill_name: Using physical cues to recognize rising emotions
why_it_matters: Body awareness helps prevent emotional overload.
how_to_teach: Discuss signs like tight shoulders or fast heartbeat.

parent_learning_goal: Build comfort with asking for help.
why_it_matters: Knowing when to ask for help builds resilience.
how_to_teach: Role-play asking for help using clear words.
parent_tip: Asking for help is a strength.

skill_name: Staying grounded after praise or winning
how_to_teach: Discuss effort and teamwork after success.

skill_name: Choosing constructive responses over emotional reactions
how_to_teach: Discuss options before responding to emotional triggers.

skill_name: Staying calm when outcomes are unknown
how_to_teach: Talk about waiting periods and what can be controlled.
parent_tip: Calm grows when uncertainty is accepted.

skill_name: Moving forward after saying or doing something regretted
why_it_matters: Recovery skills prevent shame from lingering.
how_to_teach: Guide reflection, apology if needed, and next steps.

skill_name: Maintaining steady emotions across the school day
how_to_teach: Discuss energy levels and emotional check-ins after school.
parent_tip: Emotions vary, patterns help manage them.

why_it_matters: Internal discipline supports independence and trust.
how_to_teach: Explain the reason behind rules and review expectations together.
Allow safe consequences to happen and discuss outcomes.

skill_name: Managing time for homework and play
how_to_teach: Create a daily schedule balancing tasks and free time.

skill_name: Taking care of personal and school items
why_it_matters: Responsibility reduces loss and builds respect for property.
how_to_teach: Assign clear places for items and routine checks.
Model polite language and expect it daily.
Create a clear chore list with expectations.
parent_donts: ['Do chores for them', 'Use chores as punishment']

how_to_teach: Discuss fairness during games and shared activities.

skill_name: Resolving disagreements using words instead of actions
how_to_teach: Role-play expressing disagreement calmly.

skill_name: Telling the truth even when it feels difficult
how_to_teach: Respond calmly when the child tells the truth.
parent_tip: Truth grows where it feels safe.

how_to_teach: Guide the child to acknowledge mistakes and repair harm.

skill_name: Noticing when behavior breaks agreed rules
why_it_matters: Self-awareness reduces the need for external discipline.
how_to_teach: Ask reflective questions after situations instead of correcting immediately.

skill_name: Keeping common areas clean after use
why_it_matters: Shared responsibility builds respect for others.
how_to_teach: Set clear expectations for cleaning shared spaces.

skill_name: Completing tasks that were agreed upon earlier
how_to_teach: Review commitments and check completion calmly.
parent_tip: Doing what was promised builds character.

skill_name: Responding calmly to correction from adults
why_it_matters: Accepting correction supports learning and cooperation.
how_to_teach: Role-play receiving feedback respectfully.
parent_tip: Correction helps growth when received calmly.

how_to_teach: Pause and ask what might happen next before decisions.
Break tasks into small steps with clear endpoints.

skill_name: Disagreeing with rules or decisions respectfully
how_to_teach: Teach polite phrases for expressing disagreement.

skill_name: Doing the right thing without expecting praise
how_to_teach: Notice effort without attaching rewards every time.
parent_tip: Doing right matters even when unnoticed.

why_it_matters: Group contribution builds teamwork and accountability.
how_to_teach: Discuss roles and expectations before group tasks.

skill_name: Applying the same behavior standards at home and school
how_to_teach: Talk about how rules apply in different places.

skill_name: Submitting homework on time without last-minute reminders
why_it_matters: Timely submission builds reliability and reduces stress.
how_to_teach: Set a consistent homework check-in time each day.

parent_learning_goal: Encourage respectful use of shared resources.
skill_name: Using shared materials carefully and returning them properly
why_it_matters: Care for shared resources builds community responsibility.
how_to_teach: Agree on rules for borrowing and returning items.

parent_learning_goal: Improve impulse control in daily routines.
skill_name: Pausing before acting when excited or upset
why_it_matters: Impulse control reduces conflicts and mistakes.
how_to_teach: Teach a brief pause cue before decisions.
parent_tip: A short pause prevents long problems.

parent_learning_goal: Build responsibility for personal health habits.
why_it_matters: Consistent habits support health and self-care.
how_to_teach: Create a simple checklist for morning and night routines.

skill_name: Following agreed screen-time rules without argument
why_it_matters: Digital discipline supports balance and focus.
how_to_teach: Agree on clear limits and reminders in advance.
Use countdowns before switching activities.
Respond calmly and focus on repair steps.

skill_name: Preparing materials needed for the next day
how_to_teach: Pack bags and set out materials the night before.

why_it_matters: Respect prevents conflicts and builds trust.
how_to_teach: Discuss asking permission and respecting ‘no’.

skill_name: Finishing started tasks before moving on
how_to_teach: Set clear endpoints and review completion.
parent_tip: Finishing matters as much as starting.

skill_name: Starting routine tasks on time without prompting
why_it_matters: Timely starts build reliability and reduce daily friction.
how_to_teach: Use visual schedules and consistent start times.

skill_name: Accepting outcomes of choices made together
why_it_matters: Shared decisions teach ownership of results.
how_to_teach: Review the choice made and reflect on the outcome calmly.
parent_tip: Choices teach best when outcomes are honored.

skill_name: Listening fully before responding to feedback
why_it_matters: Listening first reduces defensiveness and improves learning.
how_to_teach: Practice repeating feedback before replying.
parent_tip: Listening opens the door to improvement.

skill_name: Fixing problems caused by one’s own actions
how_to_teach: Guide the child to identify a repair action.

why_it_matters: Respecting limits supports harmony and self-control.
how_to_teach: State limits calmly and acknowledge feelings once.

skill_name: Checking instructions before starting a task
how_to_teach: Teach a quick check routine before beginning.
parent_tip: A brief check saves time later.

how_to_teach: Assign roles and review outcomes afterward.
Write simple agreements and revisit them briefly.

skill_name: Using agreed strategies when feeling frustrated
how_to_teach: Choose two strategies in advance and practice them.
parent_tip: Plans help most before problems start.

skill_name: Meeting the same expectations on weekdays and weekends
how_to_teach: Discuss which rules stay the same across days.

skill_name: Planning the day’s tasks without reminders
why_it_matters: Daily planning builds responsibility and time awareness.
how_to_teach: Guide the child to list tasks each morning or evening.
